title: Reviewable Automated Decision-Making
research_description: This paper proposes the concept of 'reviewability' as a framework to enhance the accountability of automated decision-making systems. It argues that reviewability offers a more holistic approach than explanations by focusing on the socio-technical processes involved in decision-making.
research_results: The study concludes that reviewability could serve as an effective framework for accountability in automated decision-making by focusing on both technical and organisational components of the process.
future_research: Further research is needed to explore how reviewability can be implemented in various contexts and to develop appropriate record-keeping mechanisms for different stages of the decision-making process.
